lines: Lookin' to join us in the shadows, are ye? Bene luck to ye, then.
The name's Bochard. I might be the eldest rogue left standin', but I'm happy to leave the guildmasterin' to young Jacke.
I won't be givin' ye jobs or aught like that, but I can learn ye a thing or two about twirlin' them stabbers. All in good time, though, dovecolt, all in good time.
All right, then, dovecolt? I expect ye've mastered the first step in the dance o' daggers, have ye? Aye, the Spinnin' Edge.

Simple, direct, an' sets ye up for a fierce Gust Slash. That's where ye spin yer leg around quick enough to whip up a wind...then dart in to stick yer mark while he's wonderin' where that breeze come from.
All right, then, dovecolt? I see ye've been coatin' yer blades with venom. Aye, ye'll have an easier time millin' a cull what's been weakened by yer tainted cuts.
Don't get too comfortable usin' just one type, though, eh? A proper dimber damber uses the right tool for the right job.
All right, then, dovecolt? I hear ye can swing them stabbers now like they was part o' yer daddles. A rogue strikes from the darkmans, aye, but for some marks ye need to go toe-to-toe.
Once a cull's set to drop, though, don't be afeared to jump in for the mill. I never had a whid for me finishin' blow, but the young colts like to call that move “Assassinate.”
All right, then, dovecolt? I hear Jacke learned ye how to Mug a cove. Ah, that skill were more valued in the days when they called us Upright Thieves...
Pirates was proper stubborn back then, see, an' ye had to know how to prise bitten goods from their cold bloody daddles.
All right, then, dovecolt? Not neglectin' yer Trick Attack, are ye? Click a cull from an angle where he don't see it comin' an' ye can save yerself a longer scrap.
Aye, it's a dirty move, but a cove don't concern herselfhimself with “fair” when she'she's aimin' to get a job done.
All right, then, dovecolt? Whid 'round the guild says you was in on the job what saved half the bloody city from slidin' into the sea. Don't reckon there's aught this old cove has left to teach ye...
Ye've learned all me dance steps, an' it's up to you how ye string 'em together. Hells, I expect the next time ye walk in, ye'll have a lesson or two for me!
